titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Charles Johnson et al., Indictment
CWG6654

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Caldwell Circuit. Court.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } June Term 1865,
Charles Johnson, James B Fletcher
James P Wilson, George H Rankin
John C Duke & Charlton Duke

The Grand Jury of Caldwell County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: accuse Charles Johnson James B Flethcer, James P. Wilson, George H Rankin, John C Duke & Charlton Duke of the crime of Horse Stealing committed as follows, viz. The said Charles Johnson, James B Fletcher, James P Wilson, George H Rankin, John C Duke and Charlton Duke on the 3rd day of June 1864, in the county aforesaid did wilfully and feloniously, and during the night time take and carry away with intent to steal & did steal one iron gray horse the personal property of E P Campbell & of the value of Two hundred Dollars $200. -- and against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Information given by,
R B Ratliff John J McLin
A. C. Mayes. Wm H Owen
Frank Dabney James Crenshaw
A J Martin, J W McCoy,
and Jesse Cooksey,
J. W. McCoy.
foreman grand Jury,
E P Campbell attorney for the Commonwealth.

A Copy
Attest J. C. Barnes clk
By F W Dabney D C
Bench Warrant to issue & bail fixed at $500. each

R T Petree Judge
a Copy

Comlth
vs } Indictment for Horse Stealing
Charles Johnson Wilson & others.
a true bill
J. W. McCoy
foreman. grand. Jury.
Filed & noted in open Court June 12th 1865.
att F W Dabney D C
a copy
fee 30Â¢
Campbell atty
